page.title: 11OGMORE LOWER SCHOOL
page.content: IN 1909, A NEW SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN FAIRY GLEN, WYNDHAM, CALLED THE NEW HIGHER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL. INITIALLY, ONLY SIX TEACHERS WERE APPOINTED, LATER JOINED BY A TEACHER FOR CRAFT AND COMMERCIAL SUBJECTS. BY SEPTEMBER 164 PUPILS-78 BOYS, 86 GIRLS WERE ADMITTED, DRAWN FROM COUNCIL SCHOOLS IN THE NANYMOEL AREA. EVEN IN THOSE DAYS, PIT STRIKES AFFECTED THE SCHOOL, THE LOCAL COMMITTEE PROVIDING HOT MEALS FOR MINER'S CHILDREN IN NEED. SEVENTY-FIVE,YEARS LATER,THIS STILL THE CASE. THE SCHOOL IS NOW PART OF OGMORE COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL.IT CATERS FOR FORMS ONE AND TWO COMPRISING OF 316 PUPILS.UNFORTUNATELY,NUMBERS ARE FALLING LARGELY DUE TO THE CLOSURE OF THE PITS AND LOCAL INDUSTRIES. DUE TO DECLINING ROLES, THE LOWER SCHOOL IS EXPECTED TO CLOSE WITHIN FIVE YEARS.
